rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you. See [[WP:FIXNF]] and [[WP:10CR]]
rev.diff:
Line 44: Line 44:
===Mainstream breakthrough===
===Mainstream breakthrough===
â
{{Listen|filename=ZootSuitRiot.ogg|title="Zoot Suit Riot"|description=Sample of "[[Zoot Suit Riot (song)|Zoot Suit Riot]]", the album's breakout single.|format=[[Ogg]]|pos=right}}
 
After several months of regular rotation on KROQ, ''Zoot Suit Riot'' eventually climbed to #1 on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard's]]'' [[Top Heatseekers]] chart, going on to become the first album of the neo-swing revival to crack the top 40 of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], peaking at number 17 and spending an ultimate total of 53 weeks on the charts.<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/esearch/chart_display.jsp?cfi=305&cfgn=Albums&cfn=The+Billboard+200&ci=3033295&cdi=7414155&cid=02%2F27%2F1999 Zoot Suit Riot - Billboard] www.billboard.com</ref> The album surpassed sales of 500,000 in June 1998, eventually attaining [[Music recording sales certification|platinum]] status on August 25.<ref name="SkaSuit">{{cite news |title=Newfound Popularity of Ska Suits These Daddies Just Fine |author=Stout, Gene |newspaper=[[Eugene Weekly]] |date=July 3, 1998 |url=http://www.seattlepi.com/archives/1998/9807030008.asp }}</ref><ref name="Platinum">MTV News. [http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1427054/19981009/cherry_poppin_daddies.jhtml 'Cherry Poppin' Daddies Singer Gets Platinum Record for Birthday'] MTV News, 1998.</ref>
After several months of regular rotation on KROQ, ''Zoot Suit Riot'' eventually climbed to #1 on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard's]]'' [[Top Heatseekers]] chart, going on to become the first album of the neo-swing revival to crack the top 40 of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], peaking at number 17 and spending an ultimate total of 53 weeks on the charts.<ref>[http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/esearch/chart_display.jsp?cfi=305&cfgn=Albums&cfn=The+Billboard+200&ci=3033295&cdi=7414155&cid=02%2F27%2F1999 Zoot Suit Riot - Billboard] www.billboard.com</ref> The album surpassed sales of 500,000 in June 1998, eventually attaining [[Music recording sales certification|platinum]] status on August 25.<ref name="SkaSuit">{{cite news |title=Newfound Popularity of Ska Suits These Daddies Just Fine |author=Stout, Gene |newspaper=[[Eugene Weekly]] |date=July 3, 1998 |url=http://www.seattlepi.com/archives/1998/9807030008.asp }}</ref><ref name="Platinum">MTV News. [http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1427054/19981009/cherry_poppin_daddies.jhtml 'Cherry Poppin' Daddies Singer Gets Platinum Record for Birthday'] MTV News, 1998.</ref>
